title: riot, please get unranked and low-confidence-mmr players out of ranked queues
body:
win or lose, ranked is amazing when the teams are reasonably matched..

However, when the team skills (or non-afk player count) are different, the game is toxic, and frustraing, and sometimes - a waste of time.

In silver, nearly 40% of my queues pop with unranked players on my team.. and if I stay on that team, the enemy team will often *not* have unranked players.... I believe this is contributing to an environment where savvy players dodge games with unranked teammates, causing them to "double stack" into other teams, where they get 2-3 unranked players per team. Sometimes there might be unranked on the other team, sometimes not.

Please, Riot, get these unranked (and low confidence MMR) players out of the ranked queues. They are toxic for games.


---

How do we do this?

Force them to solo-q for normals in a special "qualify" phase, so they can get a provisional MMR while playing normal games. 

Matchmaking can use these normal queue games to give a player an estimated MMR... once the MMR has high enough confidence (over ~10 games), then they will be allowed to play ranked with that provisional MMR.  If they AFK during this period, their MMR quality resets (aka, they will have to play a minimum of another 10 games).

Of course even after this provisional "qualify" period, the system won't have a perfectly accurate MMR, but at least it will be better than throwing completely random MMRs into the ranked queues -- unevenly on the two teams.

Why is this a win?

1) players who only play <10 "ranked" games a season will never actually be in the ranked queues
2) players who afk once every 10 games will never actually be in the ranked queues
3) players who have not played 10 games last season will need to actually play a bit before they can be in the ranked queues
4) new players will need to get a provisional MMR before they can get into the ranked queues 

All of these things will reduce noisy MMR and increase team equality.. which will increase the quality of games and *fun*, while reducing toxcity.

replies.body: Isn't this already present in the form of placement matches? Shouldn't those matches be played in a ranked setting instead of normals so that everyone is (ostensibly, anyway) trying their best rather than having one person relying on a match for ranked placement while the others are trying off-meta nonsense because it's just normals?

The current ~10 placement matches screw up the ranked games they are placed in.... some of these players will never even finish 10 placements. More than once I've had these unranked players confess they didn't mean to queue for ranked at all... it was an accident (their first and only ranked game). Other times there are unranked smurfs that obliterate games. In both cases the outcome is a frustrating toxic game that screws up the MMR of the other 9 players.

In silver ELO, there are so many of these unranked players, that we hardly get any real games. Especially during weekends and holidays.

Right now, today, I just had 3 queues pop at S3-S1 ELO in a row with unranked players. I dodged, because i'm tired of this nonsense.

When do I get to play an actual reasonably matchmade game? never?

My proposal is an attempt to get this randomness out of ranked games. It does this by:

(a) making players play these 10 qualification games (without afk) as "soloq noramals" before they get into the ranked queues... some players will never even make it over this hurdle

(b) using the normal queue to get a rough MMR for the players.... of course this is not as accurate as doing it in ranked.. but the 10 placements in ranked doesn't get an accurate MMR anyway. This is just an attempt to get a rough initial MMR without having them add toxcity to the ranked queues. Once the qualitifation process has given them a rough MMR, they'll get tossed into ranked.. and it'll take probably another ~40 games before their MMR is remotely accurate anyway. but at least we got them closer to the right bracket before their unranked play screwed up the ranked games.

If the problem is that people who wanted to play normals are being matched with people who wanted to play ranked _by accident_, how does matching people who want to play normals with people who want to play ranked _on purpose_ help solve that problem? I have a hard time believing that people accidentally queue for the wrong game type so often that it needs to be solved with a sledgehammer like this - maybe unranked players should get a confirmation dialog box of "are you SURE you want to queue for the ranked ladder?" the first time they select it. Is it really that much better for unranked smurfs to obliterate a normal game with inaccurate MMR than a ranked game with inaccurate MMR? Your idea seems unfair, heavily favoring veteran ranked players at the cost of basically everyone else.

You ignored 90% of my post and replied to 10% of it as if it's the whole post.

The problem :

**In silver ranked games, the player skill variance is too high. You get unranked "should be in Iron" all the way through ~G3 (or higher smurfs). You get people who have no idea how to play the game, and people with years of experience in the same game. This wastes time on games decided by matchmaker RNG not by demonstrated player skill differences.**

I don't care how riot improves this situation, but this is the situation I would like improved.

My idea, to improve it.. is to have people do a "qualification" round in the normal queues, so get them a prelim MMR before they are allowed into ranked.

This is no problem for the people in normals, because they are in normals and dont care. This is no problem for the person qualifying, because if they are going to play 100 games in ranked, 10 qualification games don't matter, and if they are not going to play 100 games in ranked, we don't want them in the ranked queues anyhow. 

 Either way, the match maker can find out if they can maintain 50/50 winrate. If they can't, then their MMR drops until they can. Once their W/R is 50/50 over ~8 games, they are given that MMR as their provisional ranked MMR... If they lose ~15 games in a row, they would just be placed in iron.

Riot purposely puts unranked players into silver and gold elo to stimulate a climb feel to these new players. It allows the bad players to think they are good and continue playing. Its a scam but they will never change it because it keeps players going.

And no these players are not holding me back in silver, ive climbed up to plat but it doesnt take away the fact that i, like other players, experianced many unranked players in gold elo. Plus your point has nothing to back it up, your playing is bronze elo so obviously you will not find as  many unranked in your games BECAUSE THEY ARE IN GOLD ELO.

I actually think they might intentionally be placing unranked players into silver in order to make silver players frusted and lose because of other players, making League more of a "frustrating addictive RNG slot machine" to engender more play hours.  Science shows gamblers are addicted to losing, not winning.

If players had an orderly climb right to their appropriate rank, where they would then either plateau or actually work hard to improve themselves.. the game might not be as "compulsively addictive" for those so inclined. The only people who would keep playing are the ones who actually want to get better.

Instead what we get is 60% of games in silver include an AFK, or iron uranked, or some other complete game-tanking situation on one of the teams. Addicted players see that as a "win" when it goes their way, and a "loss" when it does't.... I just see it as waste-of-time RNG, because over 100 games, 60 of them are decided by matchmaker RNG.. which makes the climb slower. 

Also, the RNG makes things really lottery like. Get some good RNG on those outliers, and you can jump tiers quickly. Get poor RNG on those outliers, and you get demoted to the bottom. 

---

I get that if you are truly diamond or whatnot you can climb your way out of this, by winning some of those 60% games... making the climb maybe only 15% RNG.. but what if you are truly silver/gold trying to understand how to improve? The number of extra RNG wins and losses one has to spend 30-60 minute wasting time playing is getting excessive.

You've got a strong point there, and im sure that riot probably does both of these tactics, i mean you cant really blame them either, its a smart thing to do to keep active players just a very scummy thing
This frustration will get lower as you climb elo.
